Sentencas: The vacuum plasma spraying (VPS) process allo-tvs the production of thin solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) with low internal resistances.
Titulo: Development and characterization of vacuum plasma sprayed thin film solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: This enables the reduction of the cell operating temperature without a significant decrease in power density.
Titulo: Development and characterization of vacuum plasma sprayed thin film solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Consequently, the long-term stability of the cells can be improved and low-cost materials can be used.
Titulo: Development and characterization of vacuum plasma sprayed thin film solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Different material combinations and spray parameter variations were applied to develop thin-film SOFCs, which were plasma sprayed in a consecutive deposition process onto different porous metallic substrates.
Titulo: Development and characterization of vacuum plasma sprayed thin film solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The use of Laval nozzles, which were developed at the German Aerospace Center (DLR), and the use of conical F4V standard nozzles enable the fabrication of thin gas tight yttria- and scandia-stabilized ZrO2 (YSZ and ScSZ) electrolyte layers and of porous electrode layers with high material deposition rates.
Titulo: Development and characterization of vacuum plasma sprayed thin film solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The optimization of the VPS parameters has been supported by laser doppler anemometry (LDA) investigations.
Titulo: Development and characterization of vacuum plasma sprayed thin film solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The development of the plasma-sprayed cells with a total thickness of approximately 100 mum requires an overall electrical and electrochemical characterization process of the single layers and of the completely plasma-sprayed cell assembly.
Titulo: Development and characterization of vacuum plasma sprayed thin film solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The plasma-sprayed cell layers reveal high electrical conductivities.
Titulo: Development and characterization of vacuum plasma sprayed thin film solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The plasma-sprayed cells show very good electrochemical performance and low internal resistances.
Titulo: Development and characterization of vacuum plasma sprayed thin film solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Power densities of 300 to 400 mW/cm(2) at low operating temperatures of 750 to 800 degreesC were achieved.
Titulo: Development and characterization of vacuum plasma sprayed thin film solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: These cells can be assembled to high performance SOFC stacks with active cell areas up to 400 cm(2), which can be operated at reduced temperatures and good long-term stability.
Titulo: Development and characterization of vacuum plasma sprayed thin film solid oxide fuel cells
